text: Michael George Raymond "Mike" Agostini (23 January 1935 - 12 May 2016) was a Trinidadian track and field athlete. He was from Port of Spain, Trinidad and Tobago. In 1954, he became the first athlete from that country to take a gold medal at the Commonwealth Games when he won the 100 yards final in Vancouver, Canada, on 31 July. He competed in the 1956 Summer Olympics. Agostini died on 12 May 2016 in Sydney, Australia from pancreatic cancer, aged 81. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2016 deaths Category:1956 Summer Olympics Category:Olympians for Trinidad and Tobago Category:Trinidad and Tobago athletes Category:People from Port of Spain Category:Sprinters
title: Mike Agostini
